lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, ladies and gentlemen, and welcome to this evening's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy voice actors sit around a table and play Dungeons & Dragons. If you are returning, welcome back. For those who it's their first time watching us live on the stream, welcome to the chaos. So, before I begin, a couple of quick notifications I want to give you guys. We had our first subscriber giveaway hit before the show started at 4,200. It was LL1973. Turn the mic around. Oh, now you can hear me. Look at this! The magic of live. Live communication. You have a wonderful view of this fantastic midsection. It's delightful. There we go. Is that better?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think so, indeed. Also, as a heads-up to you guys, there will be no Critical Role next week because the San Diego Comic-Con is happening. Down in San Diego.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're doing a panel, aren't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, we have a panel, though. We have a panel Thursday, I'll be on the main Geek and Sundry panel with Laura at 1-2 and then we have our actual full Critical Role panel from 4-5. So if you are going to be there, come see us at PetCo Park on Thursday.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, you can just come and walk on in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it is at PetCo Park, so don't get lost looking around the convention center. Because it won't be there. It's at PetCo Park.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Otherwise, the rest of the Critical Role cast that are available will be here and will play some other sort of game together and generally interact with the chat and have a good time until we return. So.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we're getting the circumstance ironed out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have Liam on Skype over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam, who's finishing up his vacation as well. As far as I understand, we have a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am deep in upstate New York on the Canadian border.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slowly migrating into expatriotism. Don't go Canadian on us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's frightening to drive here at night. I can't wait to do it at two in the morning.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm drinking out of your mug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On river time, there you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you instantly turn into a 64-year-old golfer as soon as you went there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm on a river. I'm on a river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm on a boat. I'm on a boat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [no audio] Well, while we get that figured out--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, is this a podcast now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, this is, as opposed to making it a surprise, this'll be our last game for a little while with--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, don't say it, don't say it yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you say it, it makes it true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Unfortunately, Travis has to leave the show.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's not true. Grog's ale still needs to be filled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. So we'll patiently wait, folks, pizza at the ready. Now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a full table behind this computer?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Am I in his chest again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you might be even in his face at this point.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's pretty good, though, I like this better than the iPad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we can see you more.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How can we not see him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Travis takes up this side of the frame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If we're having an issue with the intro video, do you want to just go to the game?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can do a live intro video.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd been thinking that this had to happen at some point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Boomf! I was being you, Tiberius.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could totally do a Brady Bunch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys are on the bottom of the feed, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So if you looked up and we looked down, we'd essentially be looking at each other.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And then everyone looks to the right to look at Mercer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, yeah, everyone looks to the same--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, we look right, you look left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look right. Everyone looks right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone looks right? So if we're looking this way, "Hi, Matt!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And I disapprovingly look to my left. There you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So I figure if the intro video's not working, let's not worry about it. Let's just jump into the game and get this started. How about that?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, can we show someone that's here that's really cool?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go ahead and bring him on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, well, we're waiting on the break, unless you want to do it now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm Periscope-ing until we're not having video issues.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, as far as I know we're on camera.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, just the intro video's not working.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we probably could have been going for a while. We've just been like dicking around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think we should go any more meta than it has to be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's jump in, guys. Let's jump in. So a little bit of overview for those of you who are just joining us. At this point in the story, Vox Machina, this intrepid band of adventurers, misfits, whatever you must call them, completed an adventure through the Underdark, a very dangerous, cavernous--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, we're gonna let Sam in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the one they have acquired is indestructible, as far as folks know, and it was decided by the Council of Tal'Dorei and Vox Machina that it should be sealed away and hopefully forgotten for the rest of eternity. The best place to do so came up in the conversation to be the city of Vasselheim, which is on a different continent far to the northwest of Tal'Dorei, the kingdom where most of the story as to this point has taken place, to be sealed in what is referred to as the Platinum Sanctuary, the oldest existing temple to Bahamut, the good platinum dragon deity. So they were given passage on a skyship to cross the Ozmit Sea to Othanzia, the continent that houses the capital city, Vasselheim. So the group gathered together, rode on to the magically elevated skyship, and are traversing the ocean carrying the Horn of Orcus within this holy container. Hello!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They found themselves over the ocean, suddenly attacked by a band of what seemed to be wyvern- and griffin-riding bandits. The battle took place on the top of the skyship, some of the magic being taken out, a few lives lost, but the party managed to persevere, take a captive, and continue on their journey, the Horn of Orcus and its container kept safe. And that's where we pick up and begin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you say all of that again for me? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so as you guys have settled in, the Horn safe, you've taken a couple more days on this journey, what was told to be about a six-day journey across the ocean, six to seven days. Is there anything you guys wish to accomplish at this moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are still in the air on the skyship.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we just-- so we fought off the wyverns.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, do we have one? We have one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is the little magician halfling still being polite and brushing her teeth and stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's right, our little halfling that we--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That you saved. She is a mage, and she has also been bound, at the orders of the captain, so as not to cause any issues on the ship while she's there. So as to her future, after your conversation with him, as to whether or not she could work on this ship, based on the fact that their first meeting involved her and her band attacking and trying to murder his entire crew, Captain Damon was not too keen on the idea at the time being and decided to lock her up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. We shall see her fate in the near future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She has tricks, but there is an anti-magic brig built into the ship specifically for this purpose.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's all I needed to know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's good to know. I was going to pay you to put the kibosh on her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) So. I'll say that Percy is continuing to read his book. The next few days pass without incident. Is there anything you want to accomplish? Anything?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You said the next few days without incident? Cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could I try to further my beard?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes! Try to grow a beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, his beard. Let's go for the beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll another percentage dice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right, that's right. The two in a row. I remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First one and the second one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 38. The little bit of peach-fuzz stubble on the chin of your goliath face begins to slowly grow. It's coming out colorless. It's almost translucent with a hint of gray and white.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A color is there. It's almost like fishing line is growing out of the bottom of his chin.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey, I feel it. It's like sandpaper, a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keep in mind, goliaths, predominantly-- especially pureblood goliaths-- do not grow facial hair. The fact that this magical feat is even achieving any modicum of growth is in itself an arcane marvel, and who knows what detrimental effects this may have in the long run, going against your physiology.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, crap. It's all right. It'll make me look really wise, you guys. Nobody will know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have some beads. If you want, we can braid it and put beads in there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm all about it. Beads and bells and shit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Give me a staff and I'll be Gandalf.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And put beads in it. And a few flowers, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a lot of concentration to try and get any sort of braidage through the about an inch to inch and a half facial hair that is growing from his chin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's really tight when you braid it like that. It pinches.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you can cast Grasping Vine on his chin and grow it out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we're healed. We're healed, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, days have gone by, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys have rested. Days have gone by, your spells have returned to you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, DM, days have gone by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Days have gone by at this time. You've continued traveling over the Ozmit Sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll get to that in just a second. Do you have a question, Liam?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, not a question, but last night while Grog was sleeping-- I can see right up Grog's nose. While Grog was sleeping, I went and got a bit of rope from the ship and used my disguise kit that I have. I sort of frayed a part of the rope and spent about an hour using spirit gum to glue bits of frayed rope to Grog's chin into a small Gilmore-esque goatee. And he didn't seem to wake up, and I'd like to see how that worked out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm gonna do a sleep check or something, right? I can't let him survive that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For this, go ahead and make a perception check with disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wake up the following morning and immediately run to the nearest reflective surface to check on yourself, and you have a glorious, dark brown, well-braided, mildly frayed, thick, coarse goatee braid. It goes about a good three to four inches from the bottom of your chin. And you are very proud.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only this one strand is this color and everything else is white and translucent, whatever--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think it looks good on you, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you! I wave my head and it whips around.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sings) I whip my beard back and forth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sings) I whip my beard back and forth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It stays taut on your chin. All right, so as you reach the middle of the sixth day of travel, the sky, which up to this point had been fairly sunny and clear, begins to slowly cloud over. The weather grows more gray, and the clouds themselves seem to cluster more into-- I wouldn't say a stormfront, but definitely a more gloomy atmosphere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if this seems to be natural or arcane?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Looking at these clouds, it is a slow formation, and they aren't moving at an unnecessary speed or seem to have any ominous press towards you. It just seems like the weather itself towards this northern continent seems to be of a colder variety.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to sense the weather, I suppose, because this doesn't look fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So the weather outside is frightful?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good call, Tiberius. Good call. I agree, it is rather cold.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Like we were discussing earlier, would you be interested in the still-standing trade of my Ioun Stone for your circlet-crown thingy?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What would you like for lunch? I already ate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. No. No, I was done with the conversation.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well. Keyleth, if you could put a little slate up for me, I'd like to illustrate something for little Scanlan. And perhaps his tiny mind can comprehend it. (clears throat)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His tiny mind is exactly proportionate for the rest of his body, Tiberius.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to walk up to the hull and be like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! Write it right here! I throw up a slate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's the strangest wall you've constructed, as up in the air on the ship that is mostly constructed out of iron and metal, there is little to no stone available of which you can sprout a Wall of Stone. However, there are weights set up on top, so what you create is less of a smooth Wall of Stone and more of a very thin, brittle shale wall that may function for the time being, but probably won't stand up for more than five to ten minutes.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I, being a sorcerer, have a special ability called sorcerer points, where I can do multiple spells in a single round.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Which none of you can do. Other than monks, of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. Brag about it, Tiberius. Just keep bragging about it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Your utilization of the actual item has been equivalent to nothing. In the interest of the group and the use of items in general, it would be wise to switch it, because you have needed extra spells like Invisibility--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Where my item would be more useful in general to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I ask, is magical ability inversely proportionate to wisdom?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is magical ability inversely proportionate to wisdom?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Absolutely not. I am one of the strongest casters in all of Draconia, and it only takes the strength of my charisma to do my stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Everything makes sense now, Tiberius.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So are you saying you want what he has back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughs) I didn't recognize you, Grog. Is that you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your mathematical skills have been quite impressive.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't like to show them off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will gladly make this trade with you. You have convinced me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now, what does this thing do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's better than the Pearl of Power!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And you don't have to expend spell slots to do the spells.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Thank you very much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god, that was so good.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You can put three Lightning Bolts in there and it costs nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, all right. I'm man enough to admit that he's convinced me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what you wrote, but it looked good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Ioun Stone which you had taken, you place by your head and release. It seems to fix itself in the air and slowly rotate above your head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost held in its own orbital gravity around your head.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh. (laughs) Oh, wow. It's like you have a halo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like a halo. Like your god has smiled on me, maybe, and said, "He's cool. Go for it."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, wow. Well, I don't know if that's what it means.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well. You know, religion is up to interpretation, so I interpret it that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Many a cart hold that bumper sticker. All right, so as this conversation comes to a close, the temperature in the sky has gotten noticeably chillier. And you swear for an instant you start seeing what looks like specks of white snow beginning to drift from the clouds ahead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sings) I'm dreaming of a white whatever-we-celebrate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was something I should probably tell you. In this area of land, in Vasselheim, on this continent, somewhere, I'm not sure where, resides the Fire Ashari. Somewhere in the town of Pyrah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, they're my sister tribe. They're a part of my sister tribe. I come from the Air Ashari.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And as part of my Aramente, I have to seek out each of the headmasters and prove myself a worthy leader.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you'll do it. You'll totally do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, we can burn shit for days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I just thought, you know, maybe after we handle the Horn, maybe we can pop in. You know, since we're here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally. You know, if you want to, Keyleth, when we go, we'll all follow your orders and make it seem like you're an extraordinary leader of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. That could be good. Oh, that sounds fun!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Good idea, yes. Of course, I will be your mage guard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do they make you burn things as a display of your abilities?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, they kind of teach me new things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They kind of instill me with their knowledge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So the tornado thing. You could be like a fire tornado?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so excited! But yes. Super nervous, because social skills aren't my strongest suit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We gotta go there. It's fire everywhere!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is everything copacetic between the different tribes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you guys friendly with each other?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, yes. Yeah, no, we're all happy. I mean, that's kind of the thing, where once a generation someone sets out and goes on the Aramente in order to come back a headmaster, and it's kind of like our once-a-generation check-in, if you will, to make sure everything's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unfortunately, the last person to go on the Aramente didn't come back, which happens sometimes. Yeah.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Or maybe they got lost to the winds of the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I-- we don't know. She left when I was a little girl, so I don't remember much. So I don't know if she's alive or dead, really, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just. It's weird. I haven't seen her, so I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you think there's a chance of when we visit this place, we might have to defend ourselves?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. No. I wouldn't think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not like your family, Grog. They're actually nice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, my family is nice, too. We just share love with fists.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds wrong in so many ways.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, did your mother have to go alone, or does your tribe permit there to be help for you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm assuming it would be okay. We're pretty welcoming.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we should totally be there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And maybe ask them if they've seen your mom.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's weird. There's this part of me in the back of my head that kind of always wonders if I'm going to run into her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How old-- when was the last time you saw your mother, or do you even remember?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was five, six maybe, years old when she left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I'm the next in line.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to bring the mood down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's fine. It's good to know this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just letting you know that we're going to be in that neck of the woods, so I should probably--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Land sighted!" A voice breaks out from the side of the ship's bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys glance over quickly to the edge of the skyship, and you see, right over the edge of Deera, what looks to be this ominous continent slowly approaching. Through the mists, the low clouds of this area, you can make out what looks to be a fairly heavily wooded and overgrown landscape. You can see dark forest peppered with a little bit of snowfall across the top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Occasional mountaintops and peaks breaking through the canopy of the distant forest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket looms up to the side and looks a bit chilly and shakes it off. At which point, Kima comes up and joins the rest of you. Puts her elbows over and looks off wistfully for a second and goes, (sighs) "It's been some time. Welcome to Othanzia, folks. It's an interesting place."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She points off, says, "This forest here we refer to as the Vesper Timberland, and it goes for "miles and miles and miles before bleeding into endless tundra to the north, so let's hopefully "not travel that far." (sighs) "This'll be interesting." And she turns around and heads back down into the ship. As you continue--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why did she say that? (laughs) I know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's warming up to me, I can feel it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the ship slowly begins to descend, you can see, in the distance, from one of the various mountain ranges that break past the top, there is one singular mountain spire that tends to protrude from the center of the forest, about 20 to 30 miles off the shoreline of the Ozmit Sea. Around the base of this mountain, you can see, the closer you get to it, what looks like hundreds upon hundreds of stone buildings. You can see little details along the mountainside. Countless staircases are spiraling up this mountain in different directions in a chaotic fashion. There are large structures, fortresses, built into the side of this mountain spire as you progress up the top. And this city proper, which spreads out, I'd say, about a third larger than Emon. Layers of walls and walls and walls. This is probably the most-fortified city you've seen in your existence up to this point. Slowly it begins to bring itself down towards-- and you can see, as you get closer to the city, the walls vary in color and material. Some look recently built. Some look like they'd been constructed in the past 50 to 60 years or so from fine, smooth stone, using modern architectural techniques. Some walls look extremely ancient, partially crumbled and having to be refortified. You also notice the top of these walls are completely covered with what looks like these strange dragon-headed ballistae. These defense ballistae that are along every single row of walls. This is a city that is meant to withstand--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- any sort of a siege or onslaught.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like it's suffered a lot of sieges? I mean, is there battle damage to the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell from this distance. You're just starting to pick up details as the ship slowly descends into the city of Vasselheim proper. But from what you can tell, there are scars across some of the larger buildings. Some of the walls look like they have sections that have been knocked down and then rebuilt and then knocked down and then rebuilt. This is a very, very old, old city. Slowly, the ship descends towards what looks like a smoothed-out, flattened platform on top of some mill of some kind. It doesn't look like it's built for skyship purposes, more than it's been haphazardly put together to receive a skyship should it come to the city. But it looks like that type of travel doesn't come to this area too often. At this point in time, you can see now, the crew is gathering their ropes, they're getting ready to go ahead and lower it down. Captain Damon is slowly steering and shouting directions back and forth to his deckhands. The Scalebearers and Kima come up to the top of the ship, carrying the box that contains the Horn of Orcus, as well. As the ship slowly makes its way to dock on the top of this mill, Kima, who has all of her materials over her shoulder, says, "All right, so. It's everyone's "first time here in the city?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And there's enough in the interim for a short rest from us getting from there to the last day to where we're at?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it cold in the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty chilly as you come down. I mean, you wear furs naturally in cold environments, but this is-- the temperature's to the point where you may have to consider getting a little bit of warmer clothing if you travel too far outside of the city.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do goliaths do? Not wearing much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a lot of winter cloaks already in my--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have some fancy cloaks, too, don't we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I've got winter coats that I bought for the group a long time ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So she pulls out the really nice, thick--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's right. We went shopping.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have three other fancy robes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We had a girl shop day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A fancy. I want a fancy robe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do? It's huge on you. You want it anyway.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'd have to take off my cloak, though, to wear that, right?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I won't wear one. I keep my cloak on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I give you a colorful one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say you could probably put it over. It will just look a little chunky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to take a large fancy robe and try to tie it up-- to gird it so that it looks okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He wants a fancy robe, not a fur.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be aware, we only have two left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to gird my loins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you gird them well. You look like the tiniest Turkish wrestler you've ever seen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, I'm going to cast Lightning Bolt into the Ioun Stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So mark that down, you have a third-level Lightning Bolt saved. You still used the spell slot, but after you rest, it'll be safe inside there. Which is an interesting experience, you see him do this arcane finger wiggle in the air, and then he releases what is a burst of electrical energy that immediately funnels itself and vanishes into the stone, which is now humming with this low pulsing glow of greenish-blue light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's green? It's a green-- wait, is it like a diamond shape?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it's like a Sims thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As long as it's green, you're happy, Scanlan!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But I believe it's white, right? It's a white stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a white stone, but the energy glowing off it is greenish in color.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm girded and I've got a shiny head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually the ship comes to a stop. You feel a little bit of a lurching sensation as the ship suddenly halts its advancing. All the ropes get dropped off the sides. They start bringing what looks to be some sort of a haphazard crane also, in preparation for Trinket to be lowered off the ship. You can see, there's a look of-- I can't describe it better than anxiousness to Kima. She says, "If you have any questions about the city, just speak up and I'll do my best."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where do we take the Horn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I believe--" And she looks over the edge of the ship. "I believe our escorts will be happy to "guide us."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to do an insight check before we hustle off.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I would like to look for any places-- oh, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and what are you trying to glean off of her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why does she seem anxious? Does she seem different? Does her demeanor seem different, or does she just seem in a hurry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can probably take it as a little bit of being in a hurry, but you also get the feeling like-- there's a nervousness to her that stems-- it's hard to really tell where it comes from, but there is a nervousness to her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kima, when was the last time you were with your Order?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's a long time to be out of Order.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of which-- we are about to meet them."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you get along well with them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Yes. They're just, well." (laughs) "You'll see." And she leaps over the side of the ship, grabbing the rope, and lowers herself down, as do the rest of the-- the two Scalebearers come down in tandem, clutching the chain on the sides of the box, bringing it down almost like a big Jacob's ladder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you all make your way onto the platform, and they're waiting for you. You see there's a cluster of well-armored men and women, wearing semi-matching gray tabards over patchwork and plated armor. They look like a really rough-and-tumble militia, but they all stand firm and as you guys walk up, they give a nod of respect and understanding. Amongst them, you see one gentleman, an elderly gentleman with no hair, completely bald, thick spectacles on the tip of his nose, wearing the same silver and blue robes as the envoys that met you at the Council of Tal'Dorei, the ones that are carrying the box. As you all approach, Kima steps out ahead and says, "Yonn. It's been a while."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The old man steps forward. "It has been, indeed, Kima. It has, indeed. And that's "Scalebearer Yonn, if you don't mind--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would prefer in mixed company the proper niceties of our presentation."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we're no proper company. It's all right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm Tiberius Stormwind, and we are Vox Machina. Everybody has names, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well." Percy introduces himself, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And I'm to understand these are the bearers of the artifact?" Kima gives a nod. "Yes, and I think "we should be on our way quickly." "Yes, yes, of course. Please. These are our escorts. Follow "suit. We will bring you onward to the Platinum Sanctuary proper to dispose of this thing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far is the Platinum Sanctuary?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to look for any temples that might have a sigil inside while we're going through the town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Do you want to ask around about that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Well, first off, you finish your insight check. What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. He seems stuffy. He seems definitely dedicated to whatever his intent is, but there doesn't seem to be anything deceptive in his speech.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So am I correct to assume our plan is that we're going to march this Horn through the town? Until we get to the temple?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, nobody knows what it is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we'll just be aware there's a huge envoy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we can only assume-- Yonn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many people in this city are aware of this Horn being brought here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, up until now, other than myself, you travelers, and the Highbearer Vord himself, no one else."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Highbearer Vor-- his name is Vord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vord. The Highbearer of the Platinum Dragon."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What kind of man is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear when he mentions Vord, Kima twitches a little bit, and you remember Kima's official title is Lady Kima of Vord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that her pops? Her pops?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (clears throat) As we travel through town, if you could point me to any place that would have a sigil of arcane-ness--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Arcane-iosity is what he's trying to say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This city, arcane magic for the most part, is not allowed within consistent practice. This is "a divine, a holy place."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And the arcane tends to, ah. How do you say, when unwatched, corrupt and destroy from the "inside. "

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm fine! He's talking about other people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't have any arcane abilities anyway, right?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh of course I do, I'm a sorcerer.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, no, I think he-- sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This here in Vasselheim, the cradle of faith, the Dawn City, of once all civilization and "current faith once stemmed from. There is no way in but by foot. It is a pilgrimage, a journey for "each to come here, and those that stay, stay of their own will and divine right." And as he refers to the guards, each guard you see now has around their neck a very visibly shown holy symbol of some kind of deity. Most seem to fall--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've basically walked into the Crucible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- into the realm of Arathis, Avandra, Melora, and a couple with Bahamut. None of--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or as Liam calls it, Sa-REN-rae.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to take it you don't see very many dragonborn in these parts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, and frankly you're making me a bit nervous."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "However, as we ourselves are followers of the Platinum Dragon, we understand that it is "dragonkind at the heart of it, the metallics, that bring life and civilization and order to this "world."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've always noticed a fine metallic sheen coming from your red scales.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I'm of the chromatic nature, I'm a bit of an anomaly in my family, they're all of the metallic brand, I assure you. The Stormwind name runs true and wide throughout Draconia, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have heard of the Stormwinds, yes."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I cast Alter Self real quick and I turn myself into, I believe, gold. Because that's the red-- equivalent of red. On the metallic scale.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. He gives you a curious look and goes--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think that would be better for everyone involved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would be mindful to not do such things so openly in public in the future."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This way please, follow me." And Scalebearer Yonn leads you--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You look really great in gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait, hang on, hang on, hang on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before we move on-- we're about to leave, I'm assuming?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're stepping off the platform onto a staircase that leads off of the top of the mill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should a few of us kind of like flank around and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely, we should all kind of surround the box, sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can go eagle form and have aerial support.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can stick to the rooftops, I guess, try to follow along.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll snick to the rooftops and try to follow along, sniper eye.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll just stay right on the path.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gonna stay with it but try to blend in with the crowd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, all right. Go ahead and make a stealth check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, ah, if you wouldn't mind, Vex, making a stealth check as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just to keep your rooftop activity inconspicuous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well I rolled a one. So that's lovely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I have advantage in-- no.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I'm taking up the rear, following behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Not in this terrain, unfortunately.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But with the forests I'd be amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do applaud your honesty, though, sister.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you loudly clomp up and begin rooftop-hopping, a few individuals in the city kind of take notice and they point up, which by the way--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wink at them as I'm climbing up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The people of this city are a very hardened and rugged folk. Most clothing is swathed in furs and thick leathers, armor is patchwork in itself, most of the men grow coarse facial hair and the women themselves, their hair is wild and their appearance very stoic and grizzled. The landscape of Vasselheim-- oh, thank you kindly. Delivery of our chicken.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as it's understood, most human civilization, and a lot of humans believe pre-elf and pre-dwarf, although the dwarves and elves very staunchly disagree, all stemmed from this city, which is believed to be tens of thousands of years old. They have uncovered the single oldest temples to the main deities of good and neutrality within this city, and as such it is considered the holiest place in the modern world, which is why it has been through many, many wars and has seen much warfare and strife and difficulty. And those that live here live here because they feel that they can fight against this, and they actually call it a privilege to exist in this harsh landscape as devotion to their respective deities. Also, because it is such a holy place, this is why the arcane is considered, for the most part, profane in public and very carefully controlled otherwise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we gotta be sneaky with that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So I'll put my spells in my back pocket for now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There doesn't seem to be a definite interest in your travel, this isn't a special occasion. It seems like travelers and strange occurrences are not that unnatural in this city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. So it's like New York.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could say that, yeah. It's a very ancient New York.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we're carrying a large ark, or a box of some sort?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are carrying the platinum box that the Horn was kept in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's approximately like a foot and a half, or two feet by two feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And it's platinum? It's just a platinum box?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, it is made of like solid platinum and silver with a series of very, very intricate scrolling and engravings on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it sticking out like a sore thumb?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There were some sapphires in there, too, some blue sapphires, I remember.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it sticking out like a sore thumb?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, there are people taking notice of it, but none that like stop and gawk, they just kind of, "huh." Keep walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn, maybe we should've thrown a blanket or something over it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could if you want to, now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards still flanking you guys, surrounding this ensemble as it presses towards the base of the mountain. You make your way towards the edge of the mountain, or where the mountain begins at the bottom of the floor, and you can see dozens of staircases ascending the outskirts of this giant pointed cragless spire that just sticks up into, actually, the clouds cut off the top of it. It's reminiscent of Gatshadow, the mountain outside of Westruun that you guys traveled to long ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But even larger. You continue up this staircase, and the stonework itself is a little lopsided and awkward, and with each step sometimes you have to kinda catch yourself, especially as the wind begins to pick up the higher up the mountain you go, and it takes about 15 to 20 minutes to ascend this staircase. Your legs begin to grow a little sore, until eventually you reach the base of what you can only imagine is the Platinum Sanctuary. You see before you, built into the side of the rock of this mountain, a grand stone fortress that looks older than time in itself. You can see the elements have weathered to the point where even the solid points and how the stonework was meant to be an edge has been rounded and smoothed down. There are a series of silver markings across the outskirts of it, which Tiberius, you recognize as Draconic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, you've been so quiet here lately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't want to talk about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a very, very ancient basis of that language.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: See that, Scanlan? That says something like Apollo Justice something.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's maybe the rise of the justice of the phoenix.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But three ivory and silver spires, towers that ascend from the top of the fortress itself, almost parallel to the very steep mountainside that this fortress is built into. You come to the front doors of this structure. Two very, very large gray stone doors with almost what looks like white marbling through them, and you can see, mostly worn away but still barely visible, the symbol of a shield with a dragon head emblazoned on the front of it, the symbol of Bahamut. As the Scalebearer-- yes, that there-- as the Scalebearers approach the front, the doors, on their own, and open to the interior, the grinding sound of stone across the marble flooring of the fortress proper. You can see the interior. Did you have a question?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see inside the temple? Or are the temples pretty enclosed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see now as the doors begin to open.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I was an eagle flying overhead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I was gonna do a perception check to see if I noticed, like kinda do a loop of the temple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I'm an eagle right now, so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're such an eagle. Oh my god.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I very, very poorly fall off of the roof and clamber down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best you can tell, there are for the makeshift guards in the city-- which, you've heard them referred to as Bastions, they're all volunteers, and actually from what you gather here, probably a quarter of the populace are Bastions. So they have a very, very heavy civilian-based militia that guards this city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are those the guys who were with us, the envoys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. No, no, not the envoys, the envoys' come from the temple of Bahamut, they have the blue and silver robes. You see, they're just wearing makeshift patchwork armor, whatever that could be scavenged or constructed to outfit a militia, essentially.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see them going up and down every which staircase, just doing various passes and patrolwork. Some of them have spyglasses and you see them looking off in the distance, and as you're getting higher up the mountain, too, you look out about, and you can see the entire forest around you. Very thick, ominous, and you swear every now and then you can see some trees move suddenly and heavily before coming to rest in the distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna go check that out first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that I was with the group, I think I was back with the crowd--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- so I see the eagle fly off and I'm just gonna follow after her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The eagle flies out of the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're gonna leave the city, brother?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gonna see if I can figure out what's making the trees move.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But do I still get shut in my face? So.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a big solid building, doors are shut, that's it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, the temple, would you like to enter the temple with the rest of the group?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So just as the doors are closing, you rush out of your subtle following pattern and, wait, and put your hands up and manage to make your way into the temple right before the doors close, catching up with the rest of the group. Keyleth, make a perception check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It is on the shiny die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Something you can swear you see it looks serpentine-like. But multiple serpentine-like bodies or forms. And then it's gone in a second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hydra! You think it's a hydra?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I don't want it to be a hydra.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stop gasping, I don't see shit, Laura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a couple ballista set loose. The bolts go flying through the air, entering the forest. You can hear a loud screeching sound, and a few dozen forests now begin to shake to the side as the creature makes its way away from the city before going still in the distance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sensation that this is a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Good to know. I'm going to loop back around. Is there like an open window in the temple that I can just fly through--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ooh. Is there a super clear one that she could try to go through first?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Be like that Windex commercial, back in the day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I break my neck, I die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are small-- they are not windows, more than they are slits for arrow defense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You as Keyleth could squeeze through. It would be one of those things where you have to careen in, transform, and then squeeze through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you do, and as you do, you come right into the face of a spear right there--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) You should have transformed into a fly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- as another one of the Platinum Dragon guards says, "Who goes there?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another guard begins to approach from the side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not good at this shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What am I doing? A persuasion check?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You're going to roll a one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, wait. I don't know why I'm rolling two.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: (whispers) No, they'll probably just put her in prison.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guy holding the spear to you keeps it there. The other guy walks up behind and says, "Let me see your hands."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me see your hands." He takes your hands, pulls out a set of shackles--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the second time you've been arrested!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guy with spear turns behind you and just holds it to your back as the gentleman who just cuffed you grabs the chain between and starts pulling you towards the main chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, can we just buzz by the front foyer, and then we'll find my friends, and then we'll all be like, hey, those are my-- It'll be fine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think that's where you're going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leads you down the stairway to an area where it opens up into a small courtyard, takes you to the right of the courtyard into a central chamber, where the rest of Vox Machina is currently being led.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you guys all see her being led in, in cuffs, essentially.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Your Highness, what is your problem?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh. She's with us. She's with us, she was just outside, we got in before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we don't know who she is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, can we have a few minutes to discuss this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Kima turns and says, "She's with me."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And both the Scalebearers go, "Lady Kima, I am so sorry." And they go ahead and take the cuffs off real fast and pull the spear back and step back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you listen to Lady Kima.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They back off and bow deeply and escort themselves off, embarrassed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was cool. You were arrested.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I knew you had it in you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm starting to feel so hardcore.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Because Kima did something super hot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, I noticed. She doesn't love me, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scalebearer Yonn continues to lead you through this main chamber. And this chamber, like I said, it's the temple. It's strange, because most temples you've seen to Bahamut or many other deities are extravagant or are, you know, built with a modern-day sense of architecture. This is a very plain, simple stone fortress. It's hard to grasp what time it was built, but just the smell itself seems very ancient. There's a scent of dust and age, and functionality to its construct. But there's still a sense of power to it. Especially you, Pike, where you're sensitive to divine energy. This whole place is humming with it. Even though it's not the kind you're used to connecting with. This is-- When they say this is a holy place, you can feel it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a scale from one to five, five being super holy--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just this whole land in particular. I mean there's a lot, there's a lot here, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need a moment? Do you need to sit down? Do you need me to hold you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I'm okay to keep going.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But maybe later. We'll see. If I get a little tired.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which you feel a nudge at your side and it's an armored elbow from Kima, saying, "If you "wouldn't mind holding off on the fraternizing in the temple of Bahamut, I would really appreciate it."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see a crude representation of how all the planes lay over each other, you can see the Astral Plane, you can see where the Nine Hells would exist, and the Abyss itself, and in the center there's the Prime Material Plane, and across it you see a giant image of the great platinum dragon Bahamut drawn in all of his glory, currently snapping down on one of the throats of a multi-headed dragon. This other dragon, with five different heads of five different chromatic colors, and this struggle between what you know to be Bahamut and Tiamat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I know that because I know a lot about dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa. Do I see or learn anything about the elemental planes that I didn't know before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from the artwork. It's very pretty.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I take it all in and I'm reminded of one of the museums at home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And actually, you've seen this art piece in a book. It's been a long time, but you know that this has been studied before and exists somewhere in Draconia, the tome that talks about this exact temple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We just made cave drawings, I don't--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The square things with all the paper leaves in them and squiggles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Tiamat still alive? Is he still around?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I read a lot of those. Can't put my finger on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point both Yonn and Kima and the Scalebearers kind of turn to you with a look of-- kind of understanding that you don't quite know, but also the fear and the knowledge that-- they don't say anything, they just give you a look that says, yes, very much so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. I mean. (nervous laugh) Tiamat's still around, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, the floor of this chamber, which is a very simple stone, you can see there are small sculptures, each one representing some sort of a humanoid entity dressed in similar robes to the other envoys and members of this temple that you've encountered thus far. Some of them are in full armor, some are wearing just robes, and they're very, very old. Some of them seem a little more recent, and you gather these each have some sort of cultural or religious significance to this temple. However, one of these is not a statue. In the center of this worship chamber, which is strangely, eerily quiet, there is one humanoid that turns to the rest of you. What you see before you is a slender, elven male draped in long, white robes that drag a few feet behind his form across the ground. He has jet-- not jet, stark-white hair that is slicked back against his head, no facial hair, frail but very handsome features. Elves, when they age, they age very gracefully--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Welcome, everyone, to the Platinum Sanctuary. I am called Highbearer Vord."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Scalebearers step forward and set the container on the ground. They go to reach for it and he goes, "No no no. Do not open it." And he kind of takes a second and holds his symbol to his chest and closes his eyes, and you can see this kind of divine glow pulse off of him for a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The box begins to pulse with the divine light as well, and then suddenly vanishes and he kind of (gasps) catches his breath. "It is as you said. This must be sealed immediately."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah-huh. We could have just told you that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives a look to the rest of the group here, and you can see there's a noticeable bead of sweat he kind of wipes off his forehead. "I just needed to confirm that this was not some "haphazardly constructed fake or some other artifact mistaken for such a horn, but we indeed "have within our presence one of the Horns of Orcus, and this does not bode well."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, please. What do you want to say?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was just wondering. You've had one of these before, yes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Our curate tasked one of our own Scalebearers--" And he looks over towards Yonn, who sheepishly backs away. "-- was tasked with preparing it for "your arrival, and the artifact's, and it was found that the lower chambers have been infested with "some manner of foul subterranean spider creature."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Our Scalebearer fled." At which point Yonn leaves the entire conversation and exits the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But not before initiating the vault's defenses." (sighs) "So thus, I ask you to complete your journey into the Hall of the Exalt below, clear "out these meager beasts, and guide your reliquary into the vault chamber to seal it for good."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Will we have to contend with the defense systems as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not all of them, but apparently in his haste to escape and defend himself, he set a few of them to aid his escape."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear no response other than the pitter-patter of steps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why does he still work here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you like to speak to his manager?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does he have tenure or something? Is it a union thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's been with us for many, many years, and he has great heart and devotion. Though addled may "be his mind, he does bring much to the temple."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait, you said you lost the Crystal of Exaltation during the War of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was destroyed during a siege of the city."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: During the War of what? Beginnings?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And how long ago was this War of the Beginnings?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well that, oh, I'm sorry. It was created in the War of the Beginnings."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was lost in a battle, a siege of the city of Vasselheim 300 years ago."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Siege of the Metal Champions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was one of the sieges and there was--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Battle Where the Thing Was Lost.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vord. Hi. Question, please. We'll clear out your basement, that's not a problem. I'd like to understand how you plan to protect this horn, how you plan to keep it out of the hands of entities who would use it for ill--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That big scary creature living out in the woods. Sorry, brother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He glances towards you and says, "Oh, that is but one of many."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let it be known that this temple is extremely well-guarded. It is continuously under "the gaze of our patron deity and while some of the defenses have been put in place for your arrival, "if the entirety of the vault is triggered, there is nothing that will make its way there "unannounced."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we to carry the box down as we journey into the dungeons below, or are we to leave it here while we go clear out the basement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Scalebearers will bring it with you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keep them safe? Oh. All right. We've got enough to worry about keeping ourselves safe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So just to get one thing clear, and I mean no (clears throat) disrespect, but how was the crystal lost 300 years ago, if it was in this chamber? So this chamber has been broken into before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We can enter the chamber under very specific circumstances. We, at the time, requested "the use of the Star of Exaltation as a divine focus--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "-- a ritual that required the intervention of Bahamut to keep the city safe."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, so someone brought it out and then was clumsy and lost it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It wasn't clumsy and lost. It was used as a focus in the ritual."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was by the will of Bahamut Himself that the Star no longer was required to exist on this plane."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She gets it. She gets it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should change your verbage here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While everybody's been talking, can I have used my Primeval Awareness to see within six miles if there's any dragons around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take a moment and kind of zone out for a second. You do not sense any dragons in the immediate vicinity of the six-mile radius of the city, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay. All right. That's all I wanted to know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we drop off this box, or what? I want to go see the fire dancers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we need to go-- we also need to-- are we going to do that now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's the morning, still. Okay? Let's go.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we all potioned up, are we all--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah? I mean, you want us to do it now, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not-- I haven't been paying attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Lest this artifact be left longer in the open, which I would not be comfortable with."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I would prefer this be taken care of immediately."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, obviously we want the Horn taken care of, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- you know, we're taking care of a problem for you, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The holiest place on the map.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The temple can provide a sum of three thousand gold pieces."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Entirely. Three thousand gold pieces for your trouble on this journey." At which Kima steps forward and says, "Highbearer, we do not need to take money from--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't want money, of course not. I mean, I--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But think of the good we could do with that money, giving alms to the poor back home where we are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, spreading the word of Bahamut where we go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are we going to return for it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We do a lot of charity work and it would be well-received back home. (under his breath) In our Keep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make a persuasion roll. You make a deception roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not a deception, we really will--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no. Only one of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The ladies of the evening really, really do need the money, apparently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. That's really good because I rolled a 19. Wait!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've got to get you deceiving more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) We've got to get you deceiving more.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You should lie more. It's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lie to me, Pinocchio. Lie to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three thousand gold, at your disposal, to bring about and to share in the prosperity of your "people back home."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Once the artifact is delivered and sealed."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From one holy man to another, I think we've struck a deal. Let's go.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Burt Reynolds, you've done it again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all turn, Kima goes, "I'll show you to the vault room."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you going to come with us, Kima?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She glances over at you. (sarcastically) "Shall we, holy man?" (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why yes, my sister, lead the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are walking out of the chamber, the doors close behind, she turns to you and says, "Is that why you were blessed with such a temporarily swollen appendage before?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let us be on our way." She kind of walks off, flustered and frustrated. You guys are led down two layers. This actual temple recedes further and further into the mountain, until you're led into what seems to almost be a storage basement. It's a very musty smell. It's old earth--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look pretty prestigious to be assigned to a basement this terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And they step aside. Kima steps forward and takes her holy symbol and removes it from around her neck. She looks at the wall for a second, then places it into what you didn't see before was some sort of a slight recess in the wood. It flashes with divine energy, and suddenly the wood illusion is dispelled and what you see before you is a stone doorway that begins to slowly shift to the side and open up into a staircase.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to find any of these defenses right away, or what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kima kind of gives you a look, shrugs, and, "To be perfectly honest, I have not been within "the vault."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Huh. Is there a blueprint somewhere?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Liam, you're up. I mean, (clears throat) Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, my communication earring was a little low there. What was said?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got it. You got it. I'm glad to get out of upstairs, I mutter to my sister, because the decor up there was shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is... high. That was a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception for traps? All right. As you slowly begin to descend the stairway, you keep an eye out across the staircase itself and any of the surrounding walls. The stonework here is also extremely ancient, marking probably a similarity to the most ancient of buildings you've seen in this city. This subterranean structure is probably one of the older parts of this temple. You don't see anything trap-wise. The stairway eventually comes to an end into a chamber about 50 feet by 50 feet. It's very, very low light. There appear to be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The brief moment of light, before your eyes can really focus in, there's a flash of light at the end of Tiberius's staff, and the room actually gets harder to see. You see there is a thick white mist that just kind of hangs in the air throughout the entirety of this room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like having your high-beams on when it's foggy.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What is all of this poppycock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your eyes adjust a little bit, and you can see what looks like-- this room, for the most part, doesn't have any sort of details. There are a couple of sconces with low, flickering light that are embedded in the side of the walls of this 50 foot by 50 foot room. It's about 20 feet high.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go ahead and I do a little Wind Gust and I go, (blows air).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Down the hall, to clear out the fog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you cast Gust of Wind. The mist that was filling this room blows out the other side and you can see, the room is a little more visible now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see now in the center of the room what were initially just dark spots in the mist, there are two pillars that are attached from ceiling to floor, roughly about 20 feet apart from each other, kind of in the center of each side of the room. Each pillar is solid gray stone with what looks like intricately carved small dragons almost curling and wrapping around the statues. Each one of their heads kind of turned, mouth opened kind of angrily in different directions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I check for traps or see if there's anything--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, both of you guys make perception checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he already rolled. Look at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So looking about, Liam-- Sorry, Vax. You notice the base of each one of these pillars is not flush with the floor. There is a slight gap, meaning there is some sort of a rotation or a pivot to these pillars.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You notice that these mouths of the dragons seem to be what's creating this white mist, and as time progresses, the mist begins to refill up the room rather quickly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Do I notice any-- does it seem-- Well, without touching it. Any kind of poisonous in nature, anything like that?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: While we're standing around, I'd like to reassign the earrings to Vax, Grog, and Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't get one anymore? You're taking it off of me right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he's giving it to me. (laughs)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Because we're always together, we're always kind of in the back together, and they're always kind of like up in the fray, so--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's true, I do wander off easily.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She's the wild card. He's always in the back with us also because we're the ranged dudes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, do I still have one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm putting down my mask, just in case this is awful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The mist has now filled the room again in front of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh. Should we try breathing it and see what happens?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just reach my arm into the mist and just see--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My Gust of Wind lasts up to one minute, by the way, so I can keep--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, maybe we should just not touch the mist and go straight through the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've been wanting to say that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you can blow it and we just walk through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this conversation has continued-- let's say about 30 or 40 seconds has gone by in transferring the earrings and the discussion, so there's still a little bit of-- there is a clear pathway in the center there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go before it gets back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You all start running through. You're running through with them and keeping concentration on your spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I perception-checked the room. It didn't seem like there was anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue forward, and as you're rushing through the group, not paying attention, you gently hit the edge of the mist barrier with your shoulder, as you're rushing to the side instinctually to stealth along the wall. As your shoulder breaks the mist--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All of the dragon mouths burst into bright fiery flame and begin spinning rapidly in the room. The people that are in the center running through right now, which include Keyleth, Scanlan, Tiberius, and Pike, all of you guys make dexterity saving throws.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Teacher, teacher, did I have time to finish my book?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said dex save? Dex save?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I'm short! I'm so short. They would--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just going to hit you in the face.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They would just flow right over me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As the flames just burst out throughout the room, tearing into the air with this reddish-white flame, both Vax and Tiberius manage to try and dodge out of the way as best they can, only receiving, each of them--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, all Vax has to do is roll, because he's already on the freaking ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of fire damage to each of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, rogue with Uncanny Dodge, for a successful save gets zero damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take zero damage, you take 12.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So I take half. Is it 24 total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, Keyleth, and Pike all take 24 points of fire damage.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are you getting used to your new foot, Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys move through-- that's the four of you guys. Percy, Grog, and Vex and Trinket are all behind, as they watch the flames burst out and they all kind of stop their inertia, and now the mist slowly fills up the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About the time that your spell wears off for the first minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The three of us, you're still back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are split right now, with the bearers, the Scalebearers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, they're coming with us, they're like coming with us through the whole thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, blow the smoke again. Blow the mist away. If you can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Burning another spell slot. All right, here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Burning the second spell slot. (wind noise) The mist clears itself. Now that you're aware of what it does, you're very careful to direct it towards the center and leave an open path. The rest of you rush through, including the Scalebearers, in the minute you have. The wind is blowing in your face from Keyleth's position. It's kind of like stepping into the force of a hurricane. You have to put your hand in front of you to see--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouts) Your breath smells pretty good, though, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, I tried to get a little of a sage thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little orange blossom. It's nice.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to Prestidigitate a tiny air shield in front of me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When I bite into a York Peppermint Patty--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's also pure oxygen, so we could get a little buzz.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very, very tiny shield. It protects this much of your face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your eyes are fine. The rest of your robes are still (windblown cloth sounds).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You then finish your spell and the mist immediately fills up and completely obfuscates that room behind you once more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now in what is a ten-foot-wide chamber for an additional-- a tunnel or hallway-- for another 20 feet before it opens up into another room, but there is no light source in there whatsoever. You, with Light on your staff again, you kind of step ahead to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to shoot an arrow in?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, would you like to see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as Vex releases her arrow, light bursts forth from the wooden shaft as it arcs across the room. As it does, you can see the room. As compared to the previous one that was square in shape, this one is circular. It is almost a cylinder in its design. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You notice that across this floor of the circular room, there are these circles marked across the entirety of the surface here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay, or sigils or-- maybe we have to activate them or not activate them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have darkvision, now with a range of 60 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we see to the other side of the room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we see all the way to the other side of the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very wide staircase from what you're used to seeing, especially in these structures.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'm hoping there's no door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No doorway. It's open. It just descends down below. And the only way you can tell is that the arrow arcs across--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to click my Boots of Haste--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What? Shouldn't we throw something onto one of the pressure plates first and see what it does?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, me. I'm going to click my Boots of Haste, I'm going to run, I'm going to do a sort of a running roll, land on the closest circle and wait for half a tick and then roll off of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, let him do it! Let him do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys are about to go, "Wait!", Vax is already off. Clicks the boots. The arcane magic of the Boots of Haste kick into his body. He leaps forward. Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hope you get your eyebrows burned off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You leap forward. Your hand touches the first circle in the room. As it does, there's suddenly a large shift in the room. All of a sudden, the hand which you had purchase on slides out from underneath you. You catch yourself on your feet, but now suddenly there's a loud grinding sound and the entire room seems to be shifting, moving, spinning in its own right, and you instinctually feel something moving towards you very quickly. Make a dexterity saving throw, Liam.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I click my earring. You're an idiot, Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to use Luck because that blew. And that's a natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. You barely manage to move out of the way before that circular portion of the ground skyrockets up like a pillar-- one very similar to the one that you created for your spell-- slams into the ceiling with a heavy thud, retracts, and continues again. In fact, looking around you, all of them in the room are now, at different levels, pistoning into the ceiling. (repeated crashing rock noises) This entire room is slowly rotating and there's just a series of pillars mashing into the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
